definition: lit. mustn't speak of two things on the same day (idiom); not to be mentioned in the same breath/incomparable
pinyin: bu4 ke3 tong2 ri4 er2 yu3

definition: (negative prefix)/not/no
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
(used in given names)/variant of 同[tong2]
see 衚衕|胡同[hu2 tong4]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to tell to
dialect/language/speech

sentences.english: Today, as your country well knows is a differnt day altogether.
sentences.chinese: 你们国家非常清楚今天可完全是不可同日而语了。

sentences.english: Because the quality is not the same.
sentences.chinese: 因为质量不可同日而语。

sentences.english: I know that their tactics don't compare.
sentences.chinese: 我知道论两人的战术造诣，那是不可同日而语的。

sentences.english: Such views of nature and history of the orientation of positivism has been a huge difference.
sentences.chinese: 此种见解自然与实证主义史学的取向已不可同日而语。

sentences.english: Bob's talent is not to be named on the same day with Carl's.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃的才能与卡尔的才能不可同日而语。

definition: lit. as different as sky and earth (idiom)/fig. night and day difference/opposite extremes/a world of difference/a far cry from
lit. to speak of two things on the same day (idiom); to mention things on equal terms (often with negatives: you can't mention X at the same time as Y)
things are very different now (idiom)/times have changed
as different as heaven and earth (idiom)/worlds apart
poles apart (idiom)/entirely different
not at all the same/substantially different
lit. to have no time for civilities (idiom)/fig. not to be outdone/not to yield to one's opponents
a complete contrast/totally different
surpassing by far
inferior/not up to par/to fall far short/to be mistaken
not to be inferior in any aspects (idiom)/to surpass/to outdo/(derog.) to be even worse
pinyin: you3 guo4 zhi1 er2 wu2 bu4 ji2

definition: equally matched/about the same
to exceed by far/to outclass
not inferior in any respect
fall short by a large amount
lit. minor magician in the presence of a great one (idiom)/fig. to pale into insignificance by comparison
